distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for glibc fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2017-1000366: Fix a potential privilege escalation vulnerability that
  allowed unprivileged system users to manipulate the stack of setuid binaries
  to gain special privileges. [bsc#1039357]

- A bug in glibc that could result in deadlocks between malloc() and fork() has
  been fixed. [bsc#1040043]
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: CSAF 2.0 data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
notes.title: Terms of use

relationships.relates_to_product_reference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP2

notes.text: glibc contains a vulnerability that allows specially crafted LD_LIBRARY_PATH values to manipulate the heap/stack, causing them to alias, potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution. Please note that additional hardening changes have been made to glibc to prevent manipulation of stack and heap memory but these issues are not directly exploitable, as such they have not been given a CVE. This affects glibc 2.25 and earlier.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
